sub_topic: The chaotic behavior of the Duffing oscillator
message_1:
A Duffing oscillator is modeled by the differential equation:

x'' + δx' - αx + βx^3 = γcos(ωt)

If δ = 0.2, α = 1, β = -1, γ = 0.3 and ω = 1, write an initial value problem with initial conditions x(0) = 0 and x'(0) = 1. Using MATLAB or any other software, solve the initial value problem for t = [0, 200] and plot the time series of the solution. Discuss the behavior of the solution and whether it exhibits chaotic behavior or not.
